thread.title: Blue Jackets beat Avalanche 4-3 for first win of season
thread.title_full: Blue Jackets beat Avalanche 4-3 for first win of season

author: senh
title: Blue Jackets beat Avalanche 4-3 for first win of season
text: BING NEWS: Highlights: Blue Jackets finally get first win The Blue Jackets beat the Avalanche 4-3 on Saturday to get their first win of the season. Boone Jenner scored twice in the win. 10/24/2015 - 7:00 pm | View Link Blue Jackets 4, Avalanche 3 Goaltender Sergei Bobrovsky had 31 saves for the Blue Jackets Dubinsky gave coach John Tortorella the win in his second game behind ... Jenner picked it up, carried it into the Avalanche end and beat Varlamov. The Avalanche couldn't capitalize on two ... 10/24/2015 - 6:56 pm | View Link Blue Jackets-Avalanche Preview Although they remain winless, the Columbus Blue Jackets at least have a heightened ... "I think if we play like this (defensively), we're going to win our share of games," coach Patrick Roy told the Avalanche's official website following Wednesday's ... 10/24/2015 - 5:56 pm | View Link Blue Jackets rally in third period to beat Avalanche 4-3 for first win of season Columbus Blue Jackets left wing Nick Foligno (71) tries unsuccessfully to wrap around the goal to score on Colorado Avalanche goalie Semyon Varlamov (1) and Nick Holden (2) during the second period of an NHL hockey game Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015, in Denver. 10/24/2015 - 5:32 pm | View Link Blue Jackets Beat Avalanche 4-3 for First Win of Season Ryan Murray and Brandon Dubinsky scored goals early in the third period and the Columbus Blue Jackets came back to beat the Colorado Avalanche 4-3 on Saturday night for their first win in nine games this season.
